alert.note: Alert for Norman (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:05PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Marsh River at Shelly affecting Norman County. Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Hawley affecting Clay County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Banks overflow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to a crest of 29.5 feet early Thursday morning. Site is backwater affected by the mainstem Red River. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
